content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

entries.title: These $140 earbuds translate 50+ languages while you listen
entries.snippet: The Mymanu Orb Open-Ear AI Translation Earbuds, showcased at CES 2026, offer users a unique blend of audio entertainment, real-world awareness, and advanced language translation technology. Priced at $139.99 (down from a $179.99 MSRP), these earbuds feature an open-ear design that allows users to hear their surroundings while simultaneously listening to music, taking calls, or translating real-time conversations. The standout feature is their built-in AI, which supports translation in over 50 languages across live conversations, phone calls, and spoken audio‚Äîideal for travel, work, or multilingual environments. Beyond translation, the earbuds function as typical audio accessories with a sleek, lightweight, and water-resistant design. With up to 35 hours of battery life using the charging case and hands-free controls, they offer a user-friendly and futuristic audio solution without added complexity.

entries.title: Meta rolls out live language translations and Shazam to its smart glasses
entries.snippet:
Meta has introduced three innovative features to its Ray-Ban smart glasses: live AI, live translations, and integration with Shazam. The live AI and translation capabilities are currently available only to members of Meta‚Äôs Early Access Program, while Shazam is accessible to all users in the US and Canada. Previewed earlier at Meta Connect 2024, the live AI function allows users to interact naturally with Meta‚Äôs AI assistant, which observes the surroundings to provide contextual help‚Äîlike recipe suggestions based on nearby food items. This feature runs for approximately 30 minutes on a full charge.

The live translation function enables real-time speech translation between English and Spanish, French, or Italian. Users must pre-download the relevant language pairs and designate the spoken languages. The translations can be heard through the glasses or read as transcripts on a phone.

Shazam integration is more straightforward: by prompting Meta‚Äôs AI, users can identify songs they hear. Meta recommends updating to version 11 of the glasses software and version 196 of the Meta View app to access the new features. This update aligns with a broader industry trend emphasizing AI assistants in smart glasses, with Meta positioning them as a platform for AI-centric innovation.

entries.title: Beelinguapp
Otter.ai App Adds French and Spanish Transcription: What You Need to Know
entries.snippet:
Otter.ai has expanded its capabilities by adding real-time transcription support for French and Spanish, in addition to English. The app, available on both Android and iOS, allows users to record and transcribe meetings and conversations directly from their mobile device or through a web interface that integrates with platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. However, it does not offer translation services, so users must be fluent in the chosen language.

The app is free with a Basic plan offering 300 transcription minutes per month (30 minutes per conversation) and limits to three imported files. The Pro plan, costing $16.99/month or $100 annually, raises these limits to 1200 minutes per month, 90 minutes per conversation, and up to 10 imported files. Business and Enterprise plans are also available for users needing more extensive features. Users can edit transcriptions to correct any errors.

entries.title: Google Translate is bringing real-time translations powered by Gemini to your headphones
entries.snippet:
Google has announced a major update to Google Translate that brings real-time translation powered by its AI model, Gemini, to any pair of headphones with a microphone. Previously limited to Google's Pixel Buds, this capability is now available in beta to users with the Google Translate app in the U.S., Mexico, and India. By tapping the "Live translate" button with headphones paired, users can access live, one-way voice translations supporting over 70 languages. This allows users to engage in conversations, listen to lectures, or watch shows in foreign languages with real-time translation delivered through their headphones.

The update also enhances text translations by leveraging AI to better understand tone, emphasis, idioms, and slang, improving naturalness and accuracy. Currently launched with support for nearly 20 languages, these improvements aim to make translation more intuitive and effective. Additionally, a new tracking feature has been introduced to monitor language learning streaks, similar to Duolingo, encouraging consistent practice. Expansion to iOS and more countries is expected in 2026.

entries.title: All Windows Users Can Now Translate Speech in Real Time
entries.snippet:
Microsoft has announced that its real-time speech translation technology is now available to all Skype users on Windows. This tool allows users to translate conversations almost instantly in seven supported languages: English, Chinese Mandarin, French, German, Italian, Portuguese, and Spanish. Text-to-text translation is also available in over 50 languages. The rollout comes after a gradual introduction that began in October and follows initial demonstrations in 2014. Users can activate the translator by clicking the globe icon in Skype, provided their app is up to date.

Since its launch, Skype Translator has seen significant growth, with call volume increasing by 400%. The most popular language pair to date has been French-to-English. Microsoft's translation services improve continuously through machine learning, which enables the software to enhance its performance over time based on past interactions, allowing more accurate and natural translations.

entries.title: MeetDot: Videoconferencing with Live Translation Captions
Google Meet gets real-time live translation capabilities; here's how it works
entries.snippet: Google has introduced real-time live translation capabilities in Google Meet, powered by its advanced Gemini AI, as announced at Google I/O 2025. This new feature allows spoken language during video calls to be translated in real time into a conversation partner‚Äôs preferred language. A key highlight of the service is its ability to preserve the speaker's original voice, tone, and emotional inflection, enhancing the authenticity and clarity of communication. During a demonstration at the event, CEO Sundar Pichai showcased a conversation between an English and a Spanish speaker, with seamless, voice-matched translations provided by AI. This enhancement positions Google Meet competitively, following Microsoft Teams which launched a preview of a similar AI translation feature earlier in the year. The article also hints at further details regarding functionality and availability.

entries.title: Best speech-to-text app of 2025
entries.snippet:
This comprehensive 2025 TechRadar guide ranks the top speech-to-text apps and services designed to simplify converting spoken language into written text across mobile, desktop, and cloud platforms. Speech-to-text tools have moved from niche uses to broader applications in business, education, and everyday productivity. As voice recognition accuracy has greatly improved, many platforms now boast around 99% transcription accuracy.

Key offerings include:

- **Speechmatics**, praised for its multilingual, accent-flexible AI-driven transcription tools.
- **Dragon Professional**, ideal for business use with high accuracy and productivity tools.
- **Otter**, optimized for mobile and collaborative note-taking during meetings.
- **Verbit**, tailored for enterprise and education with hybrid AI and human transcription.
- **Braina Pro**, a PC-based voice assistant offering versatile command and dictation support.
- **Microsoft Azure Speech to Text** and **IBM Watson**, both cloud-native enterprise solutions offering real-time and batch transcription with customizable language models.
- **Dragon Anywhere**, a mobile app delivering professional-grade dictation in the cloud.
- **Amazon Transcribe**, optimized for business use with live and batch processing.

Top free options include Google Gboard, Just Press Record, Speechnotes, and built-in features like Windows Speech Recognition. Additional apps like iTranslate, Voice Notes, and SpeechTexter highlight specialized capabilities for translation, note organization, and social media use. The guide concludes with advising selection based on user needs and testing methodology.
